intro: Telipogon elizabethiae, commonly known as the Elizabeth's feathergrass, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon elizabethiae is considered a vulnerable species.
